label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
The Discovery of America, plate 1 from the "Nova Reperta" (New Inventions of Modern Times)

label: Description
value: Amerigo Vespucci is seen standing holding a banner and sextant, conversing with a nude indigenous woman seated in a hammock. Animals and cannibals in the distance; a ship at the left. Inscribed below: AMERICA (Americen Americus retexit -- Semel vocavit in de semper excitam)

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of W. A. Baille-Grohman, for which the drawing is in the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Nagler, p. 449; Hollstein, p. 87

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Standing cup with medallions of two continents between scrollwork. Europe, crowned, holding scepter and shield with Habsburg coat of arms; attributes: horse, helmet, and banners (after an engraving by Johannes Meyer), printed on a New Year’s broadside, “Geographia,” for 1706 issued by the Burgerliche Bibliotec, Zurich; Africa, holding tambourine and parasol, attended by buffalo and crocodile. Baluster stem with knob: foot cut and engraved with strapwork.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 25.4 x 12.7 cm (10 x 5 in.)

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Deep flaring chalice, cut at bottom, and engraved with four semi-circles containing the Four Continents enthroned. Asia in turban, with basket of gems; Europe with scepter; Africa with feathered scepter and bird; America with feather cape and headdress, holding bow and arrow. Cut baluster stem and knob; domed foot, with cut top.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Pleated fan. Paper leaf with hand-colored engraving showing Minerva, with a leopard at her feet and a torch in one hand, presenting an olive branch and wreath to Louis XVI. At right are two putti, one of which is dressed as a Native Indian, holding aloft a banner saying "Vive la Paix" (long live peace). At left, a European and Indigenous woman hold a scroll saying "Etats Unis" (United States). The woman, symbolizing America, holds a trident and  phrygian cap of liberty. Above them, a putto holds a trumpet with a banner "Paix et liberté des mers" (Peace and freedom of the seas). Far left, a cartouche explains the scene in French. Background is an all-over pattern of dots. Ivory sticks and wood guards.

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf with hand-colored engraving, ivory sticks, wood guards Background print appears to be block printed. The fan probably opriginally had metallic spangles that have deteriorated and fallen off, leaving remnants of tarnished metal in circular shapes. There is a glazing over the printed colors. Possibly gum arabic?

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1960: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value:
Pleated fan. Front and back leaves of hand-colored etching on paper. Obverse: a satirical depiction American separation from England, and the 1778 treaty subsequently signed between America and France. England is represented by the placid cow and the recumbent lion, tamed and controlled by the Dutch, the Spanish, and the French. At center, a group of men saw off the horns of a cow (Great Britain) while another milks her. At left, a man amputates the right paw of the British lion while another treads on the beast’s back. Two Englishmen lament the scene and drop the deed of separation. At right, two women (France and England) are embracing, while a group of crowned women representing the other nations of Europe gather around a scroll inscribed, “Epoque fatale 4 Juillet 1776 -- 13 Mai 1778”. Reverse: French explanation of obverse. 
Bone sticks. Mother-of-pearl washer at the rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf with hand-colored etching, bone sticks, mother-of-pearl washer at the rivet

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 27.9 x 48.3 cm (11 x 19 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1960: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf with hand-colored engraving embroidered with metallic spangles, incised bone sticks with applied metallic foil

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1960: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Pleated fan with double leaf. Both leaves are hand-colored paper with an equestrian statue of Portugual’s John I in the center, having at each side one of the "Four Parts of the Globe" allegorically represented as a woman with an attendant beast and appropriate scenic detail. Pierced ivory sticks inlaid steel piqués. Some careful repairs have been made to the edges of the paper leaf. Mother-of-pearl washer at rivet.

label: Physical description
value: Painted paper leaf, pierced bone sticks with steel piqués, mother-of-pearl washer

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1960: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Panel of pale yellow silk damask with design of allegorical figures representing the Four Continents. Asia is depicted as a man seated on a camel carrying an open parasol, and behind him an ape plays with a butterfly. Europe is a seated, helmeted female resting her hand on a shield, on which appears a horse. Other attributes include: flags, trumpet, anchor, caduceus, and cornucopia. Africa appears as two men in plumed turbans spearing lions. America is represented by seated Indians, in high feather headdress, carrying a bow and playing with a parrot. Based on designs by Joseph Bourne and Pascal Picart.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 216 x 53 cm (7 ft. 1 1/16 in. x 20 7/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value:
All relief plaques rectangular with domed tops and projections to the side, probably made to fit into a specific framework or piece of furniture.
(a) Asia seated holding a gadrooned lamp in one hand and a leafy branch in the other, a camel's head coming in on the left; (b) Europe, seated holding a cornucopia of fruit and wheat above a helmet, on one side, the other arm around a tempietto a horse's head above, and with bishop's mitre in front and with ewer and basin below,  and below her feet, a classical bust on books, a palette and brushes above a recorder or flute; (c) Africa-female African seated figure, her tightly curled hair in close cropped cap, one hand raised holding a crab, the other resting on a lion, a palm tree in the crook of her arm; (d) America, a Native American seated in feather skirt and with feather headdress, bare chested and barefoot, a rugged landscape with tree to one side, holding a parrot out on his hand above an alligator under his foot on the other.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
Study for Painting "The Landing of Columbus in America," Sala del Minor Consiglio, Palazzo Ducale, Genoa, Italy

label: Description
value: Composition shows the figure of Columbus and his retinue landing in the New World. Columbus, standing at left between a monk with a crucifux and a soldier with a banner, raises his head and arms in prayer. Other men cluster around him or beach long boats at right; masts of two ships are shown in left distance.  Groups of naked Native Americans flee in terror or kneel before the invaders. At center, above rock, is the allegorical figure of Faith with Cross, Host, and Chalice, borne up by angels.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk on two sheets (joined) of cream laid paper; Verso: Graphite on two sheets (joined) of cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Embroidered wall hanging with silk and metallic-wrapped threads. Overall meandering floral motif with center motif of two metallic vases with flowers sprouting out. Edge is scalloped with each scallop holding a single flower.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic thread on linen (confirmed by microscope) Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle. 

Recto: A garden doorway, flanked by atlantes and surmounted by a balustrade flanked by urn fountains and supporting an escutcheon held by putti with ducal arms. A figure seen through the door. 

Verso: Two urns one developed into suite XI plate 9, and a section of a circular ceiling cove showing two putti holding a ribbon, possibly Inspired by the vault decorations of S. Carlo ai Catinari, Rome.

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with gray and brown washes on laid paper.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle. A tomb monument within a niche consisting of a bust on a high socle flanked by putti holding up draperies. Below, the sarcophagus at the base of which sits an eagle. 

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink with ink wash

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Elevation and Profile of a Wall Fountain

label: Description
value:
Recto: Horizontal rectangle. A basin in the form of a shell with water issuing from a winged dolphin's head. 

Verso: Vertical rectangle. A standing figure seen from the back, his left arm raised, and a seated man holding a shield.  

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink with grey wash

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Horizontal rectangle.

Recto: Four left halves of escutcheons decorated with scrolls, leaves and surmounted by crowns. One shows a half-female-half-lion, another a head over a crescent and spear-head. 

Verso: Interlacing pattern of band-work, probably intended to be carried out in marble or wood flooring. The ground is indicated in shading, perhaps a suggestion for Suite XIV, plate 1.

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink with grey wash, partial framing line in red chalk

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle. 

Recto: A tomb monument within a niche consisting of a male bust on a high base flanked by putti holding draperies. below, a sarcophagus flanked by eagles with a garland suspended between them, possibly inspired by the tomb of Cardinal Priuli in S. Marco, Rome. 

Verso: Joseph leads Mary, holding the Christ Child, followed by the ass and two putti. A vertical line divides the scene from a standing Madonna and Child. 

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with brown and gray washes on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Fountain Supported by Dolphins and Two Dogs

label: Description
value:
Jet of water from sphere atop shell-like tier supported by two upside-down entwined dolphins.  water from dolphins' mouths flows into pool at base.  Two dogs (one on each side) stand on rocky base with their front paws at tier rim.  Each dog holds in its mouth a brach from which water spouts.

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Sketches of an Altar, a Chapel Section, a Capital and Profiles of Cornices

label: Description
value:
Recto: Vertical rectangle. Top left, corner of a sarcophagus; below, an altar conceived as an a piece of Baroque architecture. At right, the partial elevation of a small chapel with sculptured frame surrounding an altar painting. Below a composite capital and two profiles of cornices and one of a base, developed into Suite VIII, plate 5 and Suite IX, plate 3. 

Verso: Horizontal rectangle. Stage designs: a vaulted gallery and a grotto. Figures shown in both sets. A vertical line divides the two scenes.

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with gray wash; verso: pen and brown ink

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Sketches of Nine Urns, One with Alternate Suggestions

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle.

Recto: Sketches of eight quasi-classical urns and one tripod. One urn is shown complete, the others, half only. 

Verso: Two urns, one in the form of a pitcher, with water issuing from a duck's bill. Below, a sculptured basin, with alternate suggestion. 

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Four Incense Burners, a Bracket and an Ornemental Motif

label: Description
value:
Recto: Vertical rectangle. Four incense burners of quasi-classical design, ornamented with half figures; a bracket composed of a mascaron; an ornamental motif consisting of a mascaron and rinceaux and another rinceau motif. 

Verso: Horizontal rectangle: a scene of classicals ruins in a landscape and two standing figures possibly inspired by a woodcut in the Hypnerotomachia Poliphili, published in Venice in 1499. 

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with ink wash; verso: pen and brown ink

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle.

Recto: Eight urns of quasi-classical or Baroque design, of which two are included in Suite III, plate 7; two in in Suite V, plate 1, and one in Suite XII, plate 1. 

Verso: Vertical rectangle. Two flying putti holding a blank shield surmounted by a crown. Below, a rendering of the left foreground group of figures in Raphael's "Disputa" fresco in the Sala della Segnatura of the Vatican. 

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink with gray wash; verso: pencil, pen and brown ink and brown wash

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
A Pierced Screen, Urn, a Fountain and Two Basins

label: Description
value:
Vertical rectangle.

Recto: A pierced screen with seraphs between the interstices; an urn with volute handles used as a perfume burner, a section of a fountain composed of a half figure and putto, and two half sections of sculptured basins. 

Verso: Four tree tubs with sculptured mascarons as decoration.

One sheet of paper drawn on recto and verso, mounted onto an album page with window cutout to see verso.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink and brown wash; verso: pen and brown ink with grey wash

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Sketch of Half an Ornamental Motif

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The left half of an ornamental motif probably intended as a carved panel, showing a lion's head above a shield from which hangs a swag. The shield is decorated with horizontal grooves and is concave in profile.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
The Right Half of an Alter Tabernacle

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The elevation of the right half of an altar tabernacle set before a large scallop shell, terminating below in a double scrool volute. The alter is indicated below.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen and brown ink with ink wash

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Pillar and arch design featuring monument to George Washington. Rounded arch flanked by Corinthian columns supporting ornate architrave. In opening, a fenced-in altar with inscription "Sacred to Washington", surmounted by urn and eagle, and flanked by mourning figures of Liberty and Justice. In front, trophies of war including arms, drum and flags. Printed in grisaille on originally blue, now gray ground.

label: Provenance
value: From a house in Sandsfield (near Otis), Massachusetts.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the children of the late Edith Parsons Morgan

label: Notes
value: Pillar and arch design featuring monument to George Washington. Rounded arch flanked by Corinthian columns supporting ornate architrave. In opening, a fenced-in altar with inscription "Sacred to Washington", surmounted by urn and eagle, and flanked by mourning figures of Liberty and Justice. In front, trophies of war including arms, drum and flags. Printed in grisaille on originally blue, now gray ground.

label: Description
value: a) Vertical motif of stem with small black and blue leaves alternating with large blue leaves with black petals on a terra cotta ground, and enclosed by tear-shaped white lines. On sides of vertical element are diagonal white lines suggesting draped curtains; b) Same as "a" except with remains of red-orange, black and white border; c) Part of the draped curtain design, red on white.

label: Description
value: Acanthus leaf architectural border, printed in shades of brown, with bands of dentiling at top and bottom edges.

label: Description
value: Ovoid bowl with straight, long handle ending in hook.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Edward C. Moën; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Soldiers on horseback carrying spears and one standing with horse loaded with provisions in front of a house. Another soldier behind a tree aims a gun at the standing soldier. Dogs are attacking the mounted soldiers. Printed in dark green, white and black on a mustard-colored ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support

label: Description
value: House and tree in foreground, church tower in background. In brown, green and white on a light green ground. Fragment of a bandbox. Note on verso: "Given to Carolena Maley Stickle, May 29, 1935 by Mrs. George Edward Follensbee of 615 Miles Ave., Cleveland, Ohio".

label: Description
value: White and gray flowers against a black ground.

label: Description
value: a) Oval box covered with wallpaper. Foliate scrolls in lavender-blue with darker blue dots emphasizing the pattern in various places, on yellow ground. Margin visible at seam; b) Cover of the same as "a". Two joined sheets.

label: Description
value: Workbox for seamstress, covered with simple geometric small-scale floral pattern, cloth pocket inside.

label: Description
value:
Large flamingo-like bird, perched upon strange outcropping. Surrounded by vining floral motifs and clouds. A fret border is printed on the bottom edge and two sides.

From ledger: horizontal strips of mottled split bamboo held together by entwined vertical blue threads; bordered with black silk fabric; decorated with silk threads wrapped around individual strips and with paint. Blue key motif along side and bottom edges, central multicolored flamingo-like bird standing on tiny island in pond amidst flowers, clouds above. Nine silk cord loops for hanging, with small brass balls.

label: Description
value: Large-scale water lily as central motif. Greek key design along left edge.

label: Physical description
value: Bamboo, silk fabric and thread, paint
